nG3ev3QRLMz2gTsVxdXX0w.text: It would be a horrible shame to give Bazaar Meats anything less than five stars. No matter how we felt about our meal specifically, the decor, the service, the overall atmosphere of celebration makes Bazaar Meats a special place.  We came for a belated semi-celebration, and we definitely celebrated by getting this special tasting menu that came in at $275 a pop. We will be eating very cheaply for the next few months, but it will be worth it! We'll be feasting on the memories of this meal for longer!  Candy foie gras with crispy amaranth - absolutely amazing. What a surprise to get that melt of foie gras! I immediately wanted more.  "Jose's taco" (iberico de bellota ham, sturgeon caviar, gold leaf) - I did not expect a thick cut of jamon iberico to be the "tortilla" but this was a damn fine taco. The mix of the salty meat and the dissolving taste of the sea from the caviar left us speechless.  Live Maine scallop with green pepper, onion, tomato, and togarashi - the scallop was naturally and incredibly sweet, but this was a dish I could have skipped.  Kona abalone with dashi gelee, lemon, soy, and trout roe - the more I have gelees in fine dining, the more I long for this trend to end. I'm just not a fan! The roe was amazing though.  The classic tartare (Mindful Meats beef sirloin, parker house rolls, egg yolk) - this was the best slider I've ever had. Why isn't all tartare served like this? Absolutely incredible.   Bison, Buffalo-style with pickled celery, blue cheese, and buffalo wing sauce - they give you chopsticks to roll it up! This was a huge surprise, and a delicious one!  "Beefsteak" tomato tartare (tomato, black olive, romaine lettuce) - I don't particularly like tomatoes, so I liked this as much as I could possibly enjoy a tomato dish. My partner polished this off.  A-5 wagyu rib eye, grilled tableside on an ishiyaki stone - well, this explains why the air is circulating so much in Bazaar Meats, because it got real smoky! Absolutely delicious.  Lucia's salad (endive Caesar salad, parmesan, Don Becarte anchovies) - this was bite sized and added in a necessary bite of salad in the middle of the meat course.  Carabineros Spanish prawns roasted with sea salt - I wish they had peeled the prawns a bit for us as my partner and I are not experts at eating prawns! They were delicious though.  [instead of the saddle of lamb stuffed with chorizo, our waiter recommended an alteration] Suckling pig - absolutely delicious perfection. After you have this, you're pretty much out for the count though. We got a huge portion! This came with a completely unspectacular mixed salad.  Setas al Ajillo (button mushrooms, garlic, nasturtium) - I could have eaten these all night. Perfect!  Buttered potato puree (butter, butter, more butter, some potatoes) - this description is completely accurate. My heart started hurting. This ruins all mashed potatoes for you forever.  Grilled asparagus with romesco sauce - this came last. I'm sure I would have enjoyed it more if I had any more room in my stomach. It was tasty but it's really hard to follow the pig.  Desserts - we got a few small things, but the main standout was a milk chocolate caramel peanut tart. Our waiter described it as a refined Snickers. In reality, this is what every Snickers wished it could be.  To drink, I had the LN2 Don't Be A Lemon ($10), which is made tableside with liquid nitrogen and is an absolute steal. With various juices and Bacardi, this is basically a boozy sorbet.  Bazaar Meats is a meal that I will think about for some time to come. It took us a little over two hours to get through this massive meal. The best two hours I spent this Vegas trip, hands down.

EtS18Wu-PlHSzazI9Pzcaw.text: 5 stars for a fantastic Las Vegas steakhouse.  My wife and I have loved checking out the various Jose Andres restaurants across the country, so we were very excited to check out one of his premiere spots in Vegas. Bazaar Meat, located in the SLS Hotel on the North part of The Strip, is a dark and beautiful restaurant that provides a truly captivating meat experience.  My wife and I arrived for our early dinner reservations around 6pm I believe on a Friday. Due to the restaurant being absolutely packed, we decided to take a seat at the bar so that we could look over the menu in a more relaxed manner. The bartender, who was absolutely wonderful, came over to say hello, tell us a little bit about the venue and ask for our drink order. I asked her to make me the best drink she recommended, and she returned with a fun dark whisky cocktail that made for a great start to the night.  As we were looking over the menu and saw items like the super rare Kobe beef (going for $50 per ounce!), we decided getting several fun appetizers along with a few ounces of Kobe would be the way to go. The bartender agreed with this approach and helped us pick out some fun options, including the cotton candy foie gras, the super giant pork skin chicharron, patatas bravas and some beef tartare sliders. Due to the dark atmosphere, I couldn't really get good pictures of each, but they were all presented in a fun and interesting manner. The bartender had each of our items brought out one at a time to try, and it all tasted fantastic. In particular, the cotton candy foie gras and beef tartare sliders were absolutely amazing! Even if you are eating dinner, I recommend getting these as starters for your meal.  After getting through our apps, we moved on to the kobe beef. While 2 ounces doesn't sound like much, it actually does get you enough for a few bites for each person. The beef was actually cooked in front of us on a stone. The kobe was absolutely fantastic and worth getting more of if you can afford it (although some of the meats being cooked over in their open kitchen area looked great as well).  Overall, Bazaar Meat is a fantastic Jose Andres steakhouse. The wonderful food, service and atmosphere make this a must-do for any foodie and/or steak lover who visits Las Vegas.

Udz0OmMHAcafmLiVMSMNPQ.text: My experience was five stars.  TLDR: We came to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday and the staff delivered a phenomenal, world class dining memory. Be warned, you'll be dropping a pretty penny at this place.  We ordered the following dishes:  - Super-Giant Pork-Skin Chicharron (5/5 --would order again) - Croquetas de Pollo (5/5 -- would order again. It came in a cute, little IG-worthy plastic too. Best way to describe this: chicken pot pie in bite-sized pieces.  - The Waygu Hanger Steak (5/5 -- would order again. A bit tougher than your usual steakhouse cuts, but this was juicy, flavorful and incredibly well liked by our table.  - Wagyu/Black Angus Beef Rib Steak (5/5 -- would order again. Fatty, grilled and well-marinated to perfection. This was the most expensive dish this evening and the Black Angus delivered solid stars. - Merino Lamb Rack (4/5 -- I'm not a huge fan of lamb, but it wasn't that bad here! My boyfriend and sister loved it though! It was a bit more game-y than I'd like it. A few others agreed too. - Cauliflower Steak (5/5 -- would order again.)  If you're looking for another IG-worthy shot and decent drink, order the following drinks: - Magic Mojito - D* Be a Lemon  Bazaar Meat by Jose Andres, thank you for a great evening. Again, you were fantastic and my table had a great time.

kmufaLXFLEYZGI24CTzU1g.text: We came to LV to attend the ISA show at the Mandalay Bay. We had wanted to try this restaurant for a while because we are meat lovers and because I absolutely love Jose Andres. We made reservations for 7:00, arrived a bit early and we were immediately seated. Our waiter Gerardo was great explaining the different kinds of dining experience and he was super attentive throughout our meal. We really wanted to try the ribeye Wagyo cut but their smaller cut  was almost two pounds and it was only my husband and I so we decided to get 8 oz of Skirt Steak and 8 oz of Flat Iron meat. We also ordered the Buttered mashed potatoes, which were so yummy, the lettuce and radish salad with aoioli and spinach side. Everything was very tasty but I do believe a little overpriced. At least for the two cuts that we had.

photos.caption: Photo of Bazaar Meat by José Andrés - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h79b8jo7PTZMy2Vz9WCOzg.text: Staying at the SLS for business and was thrilled to learn of Bazaar Meat. I am not a gambler, clubber or night owl...but I am a foodie and man this spot delivered. Sat at the bar by myself so I could watch the kitchen. Talk about flawless execution and on point service. I highly recommend the Summer Menu. By far my favorite was the Bagel, lox and CC, and during my courses I ordered another. The highlight of my evening was when I was taken on a tour of the various stations and even treated to a slice of cured meat. That paired with a beautiful Tempernaillo blend was to die for. And get this, next on the house was cotton candy foie gras. By the time I got to my beef wellington I was stuffed, but it along with the dessert menu was a great midnight snack.  I loved it so much I went back the following night and ordered strictly from the appetizer plates OMG the chicken croquets were so lightly fried...they just melt in your mouth.  The entire world should know what it is to eat like this. My sincere thanks to the entire team (especially Stacey) for making this an experience I will never forget!

oN-78JBHYrZG17e_IjE5xQ.text: This is hands down the best restaurant I have ever had in Las Vegas and I ate at the best ones in Vegas !!! From start to finish felt like the most perfect meal ever. We started with the Cotton Candy Foie Gras, Iberian Taco's, Gazpacho Shots and the Parmesan Carpaccio on a stick. Main course was the Chateaubriand. Thick cut. Cooked for 55 minutes to perfection. For dessert they ride in a cart with lovely small dishes. Staff was incredible. I would even marry the 2 hostesses in the front. Will come back here very soon

j1L-WZpCr15EDAIP-ChrTA.text: Came here for one thing and one thing only, the MEAT! if you want visual opulence and the True Bazaar feel, gotta visit the SLS Bazaar in Los Angeles. One thing i need to let everyone know is that the meat takes a WHILE to get cooked due to the method of how they cook it. There is most certainly other tid bits u can order as you wait. Our bone-in 2.75 lb Washugyu ribeye took 1 hr to be prepared. Worth the wait cooked in an open fire cherry wood (perfect smoky charr taste). My most favorite part besides the meat itself is how its prepared. A little salt and nothing else, tasting the meat in its Truest form. Dry aged for 45 days its the least fatning ribeye i ever had. Washugyu is what they are calling it that comprises of 75% wagyu from Japan and 25% black angus. Matched with their grilled leeks with a balsamic reduction was a perfect combination with the meat.

ND8THqa8bPBN5I-PT3qpMw.text: Do NOT come to Bazaar Meat unless you WANT to be treated amazingly by the wait staff; partake in flavorful, beautifully plated entrees and desserts; bask in the solace of a dark enveloping dining experience; and have a great time.  Came here to try the exclusive kobe beef from Japan! This is 1 of 9 restaurants in the United States that serves the authentic and coveted cut of meat. This experience comes with tableside cooking, as well as a certificate in Japanese (I can't read it but it looks cool enough to frame - except when guests walk in and think you earned a blackbelt in X martial arts and then you need to sheepishly explain its actually about a cow from Japan that you ate)!  Don't take my word for it - check out my photos to see the exquisite foods my group and I partook at Bazaar Meat - you've been told!

OC5YDd7ArdKnQ1uYzMmiLg.text: Seriously one of my best culinary experiences yet! The restaurant is located in the SLS. Beautiful and large restaurant. It appears to be a steak house but is more like a tapas restaurant. I had Jose's Gin Tonic - refreshing and wonderful.  What we had:   Kobe Beef - prepared tableside. Melt in your mouth amazingness   Cotton candy foie gras - salty & savory perfection   Waygu Carpaccio - wrapped on bread sticks and served with a wonderful onion sauce.   Grilled Main Lobster - Divine   Potato puree - perfect balance and texture   Iberico Pork Loin - just order it  For desert we finished it off with a bacon pastry thingy. Perfect ending.   We had all of the above sprinkled with tequila shots. Haha.   Guaranteed to enjoy your meal here! Our server was beyond amazing.   Cheers!

-gP4x-RqvHzE-oGcG2DAog.text: Supremely creative tasting menu but at a steep price. Visited on a week night and the place was full of energy. Great decor that is comfortable but still upscale. The food was really great. I will say I didn't love everything I tried but definitely still enjoyed trying the creative dishes. The cotton candy foie gras is a must try. Of course the Meats were cooked beautifully, seasoned well and melted in your mouth. I'm pretty sure this will be a regular stop for me when I'm in town.

PFzf4CC0bubIuRab_dHu1w.text: Enthusiastic five stars for a fantastic dining experience in a first-rate environment.  My husband and I were delighted with every single dish we tried. We sat at the bar and the service was excellent. The service was prompt and the interior of the restaurant was lovely.  As we sat at the bar, we ordered a sampling of the happy hour items and also the authentic Kobe beef! The Kobe beef served here is one of the only places in the United States you can get real Kobe beef delivered directly from Japan. It was incredible and served in tiny slices and cooked fresh on a hot rock at your table. It was an incredible experience and worth the high cost.   As far as the happy hour items, we tried the foie gras cotton candy, the chicharones, the suckling pig sandwich, the kobe beef air bread and beef tartare sliders. We also tried the house red and the salt foam margarita!  The salt-foam margarita was incredible and well worth the price. The house red was underwhelming and I would opt for something else. The chicharones were fine, as were the sliders. The suckling pig sandwich was fun and the air bread was tasty. However, the foie gras cotton candy was incredible! It was savory and sweet and so creative. We both ordered a second round and I could eat a ton of these.   Overall, this is an exceptional restaurant featuring incredible meats and unique options.

photos.caption: Photo of Bazaar Meat by José Andrés - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bazaar Meat by José Andrés - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bazaar Meat by José Andrés - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y3WT0IBG-QFPBrOmLIj2iQ.text: Had a great meal at Bazaar meat last night for a buddies birthday. The restaurant is chic and interesting yet too dark. Turn up the lights a bit. My only complaint is it's location in a small down market casino (SLS) I had never heard of. They must have paid some big bucks to get Jose but I don't think clientele from this casino is patronizing the restaurant. Too bad about the location I hope it does not sink the restaurant. On to the food. This is a tapas restaurant for meat. Sharing is a must. Don't order a steak for yourself. We started with the cotton candy foi gras which apparently everyone orders. A bit gimmicky but good. Tastes like foi gras wrapped in cotton candy as advertised. We then had a nice selection of raw oysters. They need to add PEI oysters which are the best. They mostly had west coast options. We then had the Parmesan breadsticks wrapped in carpaccio with an onion dip which was tasty but not amazing. The table next to us ordered the steak tartar with Parker rolls which looked better and was a sizable portion. For an entree we split the ribeye which was bone in and about 20oz with the bone. More than enough food for two hungry guys. We did the wagyu-Holstein mix which was nicely marbled. They suggested that option over the straight Holstein which I would usually ordered as the straight Holstein was apparently tough. Not sure why this would be and presumably they can source a tender cut which is not a wagyu hybrid. If you don't like highly marbled (fatty) meat pick something else. It was delicious however and I like marbles. My partner ordered the steak cooked medium and it was served med rare or even rare. No surprise as this happens often. The Delmonico potatoes were delicious and worth ordering. Think double baked potato with cheese. No veggies on our table, we were pure carnivores. That was definitely enough food. For desert we did not get to choose as they did a special birthday selection of small deserts items that were all good but to be honest did not blow me away. The tart with Carmel was the best but we should have ordered from the desert menu. What made the night was the Somm. I wanted red wine and my partner wanted to drink Martinis so I called to Somm over and he worked with me to offer some high end French old world Bordeaux by the glass so I did not have to buy a full bottle. He brought 3 bottles over for me to taste which was fun and we settled on one I liked and he gave me a very fair cut rate deal for such a fine wine ($60 per glass as opposed to $90 per glass). As I said we were celebrating. Our bill with drinks was $400 which felt appropriate for such a meal. Not cheap however so leave room on your card. All in all a very fine evening and my partner loved the experience. During the meal we had a 7.1 earthquake and the chandeliers started swinging.  Staff handled this with no issues and everyone shrugged it off.  So go already.

photos.caption: Photo of Bazaar Meat by José Andrés - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat
Photo of Bazaar Meat by José Andrés - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef carpaccio Parmesan breadsticks
Photo of Bazaar Meat by José Andrés - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cotton candy foi gras

ZYrw0tbp41GRQq56LvFhgQ.text: We were staying across the street and the SLS offered the most food options for dinner.  It was the last night of our trip so I decided we would splurge and try the famous Bazaar Meat.  The good news is that if you are on a budget, you can sit in the bar area and enjoy discounted plates and drinks.  We enjoyed the roasted octopus, 1905 carpaccio, and the gazpacho soup.  The carpaccio was served with shaved parmesian, fresh herbs and a drizzle of oil ($24).  The octopus was  served in a small bowl with a reduction of something wonderful ($12 on happy hour menu).  The gazpacho was the smaller of the two servings in a high-ball glass with a round ice cube in it.  Service was excellent throughout. If I return, I shall try the cotton candy mojito.  They have a cotton candy machine at the bar and it was fun watching them make various dishes with it.

GgCk-9xfsXT0JW4K6eyQBw.text: I had great expectations about this place. Service was beyond perfect but the place is pricey and the food is totally average. The price has nothing to do with the quality of the food. Dessert was the best part of our night!

XIWQPVsKZ-At-IgIneC1kQ.text: Came here for our 5th year anniversary dinner and we definitely weren't disappointed. The restaurant is located in SLS which is eh, but it the restaurant itself was a great experience.  Once we arrived for our reservation time we were seated right away and the hostesses congratulated us on our anniversary.  Our server explained the menu in detail since this was our first experience. We both ended up sharing some plates to get the most out of the experience.  Caviar trio - we wanted to try the trio that had the salmon caviar and was not disappointed. It came with a puffed kind of cracker with sides of red onions, eggs, egg whites, olive tapenade and I want to say maybe parsley.   Bison carpaccio - must order. This melts in your mouth.  Buttered potatoes - very creamy and buttery. I almost ate the whole thing on my own.  Asparagus - grilled with a tomato like sauce. Delicious.  Steak - I honestly don't remember what steak we ordered but it was prepared perfectly. We ordered medium rare and it was just enough pink where we enjoyed the flavor of the steak.  Overall if you are a meat lover, then this place is a must try. They also offer tasting menus where you have a little bit of everything. Portions are a good size to share and the staff was impeccable. Everyone that worked their was so nice and friendly. Definitely would come back again to try other items here.

O_uonLbX2qssYeMMI3Da3g.text: Our waiter Abu provided amazing service, we were the 2nd group to be seated and he poured through the menu explaining the kitchens and dishes uniqueness with pride. The ribeye took nearly an hour to cook and it eae worthwhile. Be prepared to spend 2 hours here if you order a thicker cut of meat!

i5WSLoAHqUX9cyIcgnMzqw.text: We have enjoyed dining at several of Jose Andres' restaurants over the years so our expectations were very high. We were not disappointed at all! From the moment we arrived we were greeted and given a tour of the restaurant. Our server was exceptionally helpful and eager to make sure that we experienced an amazing dinner. We went with the Jose's Way Tasting Menu for $185pp and it was the best choice for tasting lots of items on the menu. The Cotton Candy Foie Gras is a hands down must for anyone along with the Bagel & Lox comes. We could have devoured 100 of these! We would recommend this outstanding dining experience to anyone wanting a special night out!!

jhNHYd08A30mZtEQM7klRg.text: Great, high end dining experience. Steaks are good, but I'd go with some of the other meats on the menu. Everyone in my group thought the suckling pig, rack of lamb, and veal chop were the best they have ever had.   Five stars if the wine list was more approachable, and the service was as high end as the check.

photos.caption: Photo of Bazaar Meat by José Andrés - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone-in strip for two

xHiv5bgu3PxD3Oii6ARvIQ.text: Oh my gosh!! The whipped mash potatoes had to be the creamiest potatoes I've ever had! The chateaubriand was the top 2 steak I've ever had. Seasoned and cooked to perfection. The cotton candy foil gras was amazing. The beef carpaccio wrap around the parmigiana bread stick is a must try for large groups. I can't wait to go back!!   My only gripe was that I sat in the bar on a week night and it wasn't busy there and felt kind of cold and empty. I walked into the dinning area and it was lively and busy and you could see all of the food stations.

X_CsVe8D06zk1vQXUi9MLQ.text: Without trying to break the bank, I wanted to sample some of the food at Bazaar Meat. I decided to sit at the bar so I could sample their Bar Centro menu. Since the food here is tapas style, I ordered a number of dishes including oysters, gazpacho shot, croquetas de jamon, cotton candy foie gras, "beefsteak" tomato, and the suckling pig sandwich pair with their house sauvignon blanc wine.   The oysters were from British Columbia. They were really tiny, but were really good. The gazpacho shot (composed of green peppers, tomato, and green pepper) was refreshing to the palette. The croquetas de jamon were served in a plastic molded shoe. It was actually a really nice presentation, although I'd never eat from a real shoe.   I am an avid fan of foie gras. When the cotton candy foie gras was brought to my table, I basically ate the exterior of the cotton candy until I reached the center of the cotton candy which housed the tiny piece of foie gras. At first, I thought it was an odd combination to have cotton candy, but it works as a food pairing that complement each other in the sweetest way.  Towards the end of my meal, I ate their "beefsteak" tomato which is ironically a vegetable tartare. After taking a bite out of the beefsteak tomato, I realized that I should have chosen a dish that was more substantial in protein like real steak.   Finally, the suckling pig sandwich was delicious. It had some of the skin intact from the pig which enhanced the flavor. I am excited to one day come back to Bazaar Meat and try their regular menu although just be prepared to allocate a large sum of money to pay for the large bill.

ExA9sMJLcuv7GRO9--v5SA.text: This was some of the best steak I've had in a very long time. For a more intimate experience, this place has a great vibe and the service is top notch. The portions are more for sharing than individual plates, but that makes the experience better.   Keep in mind, this place is Vegas pricey, but that shouldn't be a surprise. I'd go back here in a heartbeat.

kYxeS-yOh3lPGqUtRRsImQ.text: Wow!!!! First time here and it was amazing service, food, ambiance, EVERYTHING!!!! My Hubby and I came here to celebrate our 1 year anniversary and it didn't disappoint! I was nervous about the food, I saw online and was like uhhhh... but I was quickly surprised and everything was delish! We had the wagyu jerky, beef carpaccio, salad with yummy lemon dressing, small potatoes and sauteed spinach. I had the Manhattan OMG! So delish!!! Our waiter, Matthew was so incredibly knowledgeable as he worked at the Miami outlet and gave us major history on Jose Andres which was so cool! We were treated to a beautiful anniversary dessert and we also had an eclair. Thank you so much to the staff, the chefs and everyone here for making our night an anniversary to remember! We will see you soon!!!

hfKDtIznLpoDJXDmBa2kXw.text: I had a great experience here ... we did the best of The bazaar tasting menu a while back and pretty much everything tasted great. The standouts were the jamon croquettes (although some at the table said theirs were cold on the inside) and the whipped mash potatoes) I've been back to Vegas a few times since going here and I always want to go back to this place for a steak, the potatoes, and a bottle of wine.

awu-FodepkyzrmKKf-E4UA.text: WOW. What a wonderful and deliciously unforgettable dinner. Thank you to the amazings chefs and staff here. ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL! My steak was perfect , potatoe puree was perfect everything was amazing !  I definitely will come back every single time I am in Vegas!

kvdKYCe3rtUIXTdMknmKSQ.text: This is a fine dining, world class experience. Don't judge the place harshly just because it's in Vegas...we all eventually wind up there, one way or another.  Jose Andres' reputation is already established. He doesn't *need* this place to make it. You can go to his restaurant in Beverly Hills or... come have a much better time in Vegas at Bazaar. The experience we had was excellent!  You can choose to go ala carte, order the tasting menu, or go boldly and order as you please. No matter what path you choose, the staff will not let you go wrong. Just remember; you are paying for service, so listen to their sage advice. From the kitchen, to the restaurant floor, these professionals will help make your experience exceptional. Have faith in them, put yourself in their hands, and you will not be disappointed.   Fair warning: You're now in a restaurant for grown people. The food is expensive for all the reasons I've listed above. Its possible to make this work on a budget, but getting out of here for less than $300 for two people with drinks is pretty unlikely. You will most likely feel cheated. Come here because you have the money to spend for an *exceptional* dining experience. You will feel the love Jose Andres has for his roots in Spain, and respect him flexing his culinary muscles here with us. He's a master. Thanks for sharing with us Jose.

ts8uF-ztKcV4WUMihiDkzQ.text: I wanted to try Bazaar Meat for a while, so I chose to come here for my bday dinner date with my hubby. We had a wonderful time! They do a great job being high end without being pretentious. Very friendly service, our server really knew his stuff. We decided to try the tasting (the least expensive of the three tasting menus) and it was quite fun. Each dish was creative and delicious. The menu is a little intimidating so it was nice to not have to choose what to order. But now that I have tried several menu items I would surely opt to create my own menu rather than choosing the tasting menu.  My faves: FOIE COTTON CANDY. Buttered Potato Puree. Grilled Asparagus. Classic Tartare. I would love to go back and try the Kobe, Sea Urchin, Foieffle, Suckling Pig. Didn't love: The Chateaubriand. Was well prepared, well seasoned, just not my favorite cut of meat.  Why 4 stars? While we had a wonderful time and everything was great, my least favorite part of the meal was the meat. I feel that the meat should really shine at a steakhouse, especially at this price point.

6h30ncR1W45q74xMcOnwsA.text: One of my favorite meals ever! We bought couple pounds of Rib Eye, a couple pounds of suckling pork, a turbo fish, some chicken and shared in our 8, incredible whipped potatoes, and sauteed mushrooms, Perfectly prepared and elegantly presented, everything a taste of heaven. If you have plenty of $ to blow, I'd choose here!

XpmtuUOmKhnkFgjshOw56w.text: Loved the both the steak and veggie tartar. Our waiter was extremely professional and helped us greatly throughout the evening with our ordering decisions. The somm was also excellent and a pleasure to discuss the wine choices with.  The only reason it's not my 5 star favorite is the location and the overall feel of the interior doesn't really suit my preference.

ljRfFyUw9Aa6y5DNlsgwBw.text: This was our last meal in a series of 5 star restaurant dining and it was the obvious show stopper.  Everything, every detail, was phenomenal.  Let me start out by saying that Alex and Tony were an amazing team and  assistant manager, Pano, gave me a tour of the entire 5 kitchen masterpiece.  I'm pretty sure that Tony and my husband started a bromance over talks of scotch and he won my 3 year old daughter over with the plate of desserts at the end.    So what did we get?  A little bit of everything.  The cotton candy foie gras was probably the most fun thing that I ate all week.  Other appetizers included the tartare (which honestly, my husband is a purist so he wasn't a huge fan of the anchovy, but I loved), we ordered the Croquetas de Pollo, Sloppy Joe, and Foieffle for our daughter but she was being *difficult* so we ended up eating them for her.  Fantastic.  Get-The-Foieffle!  I know what you're thinking, could you even eat anymore after that?  The answer is yes.  We couldn't stop eating the delicious foods in front of us.  For our main, my husband got the Bone-In Strip Loin cooked medium because we were told that a ribeye would take at least an hour and we didn't expect to be there for that long; we were there for a little over two.  So for future reference, if you're eating here, you're going to be there for over an hour anyway, so get the steak you want.  That being said, we still LOVED the strip.  It was amazing.  (Good suggestion, Tony).   I got the Braised Lamb Neck.  Some reviews I'd checked online said it was too rich or salty and my personal opinion is that they were wrong.  The meat was so tender and the flavor was out of this world. I'm obsessed with the oyster catsup that came on it and the little fried oysters were just a great texture to throw in.  Simply amazing.  We try to not hit up the same restaurants every time we go to Vegas, but we've pretty much decided that we will make an exception for Bazaar Meat.  I'm going to point out something that Pano said to me during the tour:  this is NOT a steakhouse.  This is an experience.  And when you go in there you will see how passionate everyone who works there is about what they are offering to their guests.  P.S.  Tony?  We demolished those desserts, thank you!

PoL25ZdPPCdVHlsgbxu8aw.text: On a business trip to Vegas and really stayed away from the strip to eat more local stuff versus the food you find on the strip. This is the place we decided to go on a recommendation when we did venture over to the strip. Know that when you park you will either valet or park in a garage. Not a big deal but be aware that Parking isn't that easy.   We were able to get a table pretty easily. I only this place 4 stars not because of the food but because of the price. Yes, they have a ton of options and I'm sure they're all excellent. What I would complain about would be the prices for some of the menu items. They charged $15 for all sides. To be honest, they weren't all worth $15. They said it could feed 2 and they did. But there's only so much you can do with asparagus. They grilled it and the some cheese on top. Bam, $15. Do that a couple of times and your bill really gets up there.   Finally, be aware that the entire menu is family style. So when ordering, you have to make it work for everyone at the table. They have smaller portion sizes but you guessed it, overpriced in my opinion. We picked something we knew we could finish. It was excellent. Prepared well and very tasty. I just couldn't get over the price and really couldn't justify it.  The wine selection was great but somewhat limited if ordering by the glass.

wW_bp9Uk6rPvtEQ6CyCpKg.text: By far the best meal I have ever had. Started with the classic tartare and some Salt Air Margaritas. Unbelievable. Next was the Waygu/Black Angus and it was the best piece of meat I have ever had. I will be back and can't thank you enough for the experience

photos.caption: Photo of Bazaar Meat by José Andrés - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AUrp19B-EHjSd15aCK5Smw.text: Very disappointing. The reason for 2 star instead of zero was for its presentation and the meat locker. I love seeing aged meat being on display. We ordered 1/4 suckling pig, aged wagyu ribeye, chateau briand, cotton candy foie gras and other apps. We were very excited about the pig and steaks. All three were tasteless. Maybe lacking in salt. The ribeye was dry and full of fat (actually half of it was fat). The Chateau was cooked pretty well, but tasteless. Cotton candy was the highlight, except the kids loved it and took our share. We saw the billboard saying that this was top 5 US steakhouse. Tonight was certainly not the night.

ztc5NPbDW7BJxg_90cbhqg.text: This review is rated upon the fact that Bazaar is known as one of the best steak houses in the United States. If you were to stumble in here in hopes of a good meal, you would receive just that. However, good is where it ends. In terms of the actually execution of every dish, it was quite nice. The issue itself is based upon the recipes themselves. To start the meal, we were persuaded with the live scallop. Yes, just one scallop that was incredibly overpowered by a sour vinaigrette as well as Serrano peppers. The flavors did not bring out the delicacy of the scallops but instead masked the flavors and created a unharmonious dish. Next was the classic tartare which we had heard great things about. The quality of the meat is undeniable, but the accouterments were lack luster. At this price range I would expect... no demand fresh rolls. Instead we were served cold and slightly stale mini rolls. The entire table agreed that we would of preferred a luke warm Hawaiian roll to what we were served. The octopus was quite nice, it was very tender and had a slight taste of the fire it was cooked on but again, the notes of the dish felt quite muddled and flat. And finally we arrive at the main course, the creme de la creme of culinary beef. Be warned that the size steak you pay for is not what you receive. Our bone was twice as thick as the actual strips of beef that lay on the plate. Yes I understand a steak shrinks, but there is no way a aged 2 pound steak is turned into a lackluster one pound over priced mess.   If you wanted a great steak, I could assure you that I could prepare a steak of higher class in my kitchen. It was unevenly seasoned and chewier than any steak over $60 should ever be. This steak is prepared over an open flame but not a hint of smoke or any real flavor can be found. The leaks we received were cold but when we let the waiter know they did take those off the bill. So kudos on proper service. The three of us agreed that the best part of the meal were the button mushrooms. Let that set in... the best part of a $300 meal were a side of button mushrooms.   A completely uninspired meal in a cluster fuck of an uninspired restaurant.

5gSwiSOAB1I9mJVYfi6HTA.text: Everything, perfect.  The server took notes from my OpenTable rez, brought us some comp'd wine for the occasion, and was extremely knowledgable and on point.    Cotton candy foie gras? Insane.  Foiffles? Unreal.  Smores Foie gras? So savory.  Beef is smoked and second to no other steak I've had in the past.    Will repeat many times.

kenZyqrXT2Fyo1kVeI-gfg.text: You don't go into a place like this and expect it to be like any other place you've ever been too. It is expensive but you already should have known that going in. What you pay for is an experience your mouth will enjoy and remember for a lifetime. This is a place to get you excited about food again. Very inventive, imaginative, creative, and super fun! Since it was our first visit they recommended us do the chef's tasting. So that's what we did and we were so happy that we did. We've got a little tasting of almost all the things that they offered. We were all so happy, it was the perfect dining experience. Kudos to the waitstaff and the chefs

B19sCayOhT4yMyKLxqU17w.text: Some of the best and most flavorful steaks that I've ever had. We had 2 huge Ribeyes from different ranches and some A5 Kobe. The Ribeyes were both excellent and had very unique differences in taste. I'm glad that the waiter recommended that we try the different Ribeyes. The Kobe was cooked tableside on hot stones. Absolutely perfect! The desserts didn't disappoint either. The service was very good and the waiter was extremely helpful. I have recommended this place to multiple friends and family and there is no doubt that I'll be back when I'm in town.

PWJkQpoVWMt-OOK45smH2Q.text: This place is amazing! Super staff! The cotton candy foie gras was awesome! Carpacio with parmesan sauce was amazing! The tomato tartare was phenominal! Suckling pig melts like butter! Really amazing drinks! This is my new special dinner place!

e_cfIwEV-H6R1jY0lkrqrQ.text: This place is amazing, we started out with the gazpacho-- wow-and everything we ordered was truly perfect.  I picked out the restaurant and my boyfriend I loved every single thing we ordered.   Our server, Mark, was I think the best server I've ever encountered at any restaurant. Truly knew the menu and clearly loves all the food and had  tried everything on the menu.

qrCgD5cAGVOsyddsBeL7yw.text: Probably one of thee best dining experiences I've had. What made it especially great was our server Michael! He was amazing. He took his time, broke down the menu for us and suggested apps and entrees for us. He had a great attitude and made a great impression on us. When we return, we will definitely be requesting him.  And the food... Of course everything was amazing! Anyone and everyone can tell you that.  Our Meal: Cotton Candy Foie Gras Jamon Croquetas Croquetas de Pollo Sloppy Joe Crab Legs Veal Chop   Along with a few other sides and multiple pickings of dessert. Not a single thing we disliked.   Average $100 per person

UhifirowvHQzVbiL2Hh_aA.text: This was one of the best meals...ever. The menu was a lot to wrap your head around, so we went with the best option: chef's choice. Seriously, just go that route. We are 10-12 of the tastiest dishes I have had in a long time. The staff was great, and was able to be personable, even with our group of 12. The bar area is a nice place to gather beforehand. One change I would do next time is to sit closer to the grill, so I could watch. Our group was too large to sit over there this time.

NyAZtgvXBdckloRc65D3zQ.text: Left feeling hungry. A ridiculously over-priced tiny-portioned meal. Laughably small portions. The service was no more exceptional than any of the other Vegas restaurants.  $944 for six people with the $144 tip included.  Go anywhere else. The meats and vegetables are just not worth it.

LRjCrg5o6hq6JLl9AS--rw.text: I love Baazar in LA so decided to come here for Valentine's Day dinner. We didn't arrive till 9:30pm and it wasn't busy at all. There were at least 20+ workers standing around chatting. Our waitress barely check up on us and we waited at least 30 mins for the main entree after finishing all of our appetizer. When we were done, I wanted dessert but couldn't find our waitress. We waited for another 30 mins and noticed everyone else was just standing around chatting. I finally asked the bust boy to get us the bill because I was so annoyed. Waited another 15 min, no bill. Had to ask for it again and the bust boy said he was waiting on the waitress for that. Took another 15 min until we finally got our bill. Meanwhile, the table next to us receive wonderful service and they came in after us. I understand if you're busy but when u have ppl standing around doing nothing, This is unacceptable. For the price that we are paying, we expect good service if not good food. Now as far as the food, it wasn't all that great either. A little bit on the salty side or just plain bland. First time here and would never come back! Thanks for ruining our Valentines dinner. I'm only taking off 2 stars for service and one for food..... and yes I did leave a tip even though I wanted to leave none.

5fcaUvYjDKW2UYEA7ICs3Q.text: This place is amazing. I don't think you need an explanation. Be ready to spend some scratch. You'll be satisfied.

l8XbhVrMdx_zslrdQQVXEQ.text: First and probably only time we'll ever eat at this place. Very disappointed with the Washugyu Ranch Ribeye.  It was not "melt in your mouth" I was expecting for the price I paid and had to spit out some of the tough parts.  Shame on you for charging people $$$$ for Sizzler quality meat.  And then our server recommended the Robuchon potatoes without any warning of the artery clogging amount of butter it had.  Overall, I've had better steak elsewhere and will probably avoid this place in the future.

K9nq0AlBpePd1IH_MvdSZg.text: Best Restaurant I've been to in the United States! True story.  Let's start with the service. We arrived a little early so the hostess sat us at the bar for cocktails. Our bartender was nice, but what was most impressive is that he had a good knowledge of the items on the food menu so we were able to get a head start on all the awesome details surrounding the food and its sources. Once we were seated, our server, Natalie, introduced herself and was most gracious, and throughout our meal, everyone from the staff who came by our table was also very gracious and polite.   We had been looking forward to trying the suckling pig so when Natalie told us that they had run out, I was a little dismayed. They, however, made it up to us by giving us a complimentary serving of a range of things from their menu. We started off with the Brussels Sprouts Petals salad, which is one of the best salads I've ever had - the petals weren't bitter as they can be sometimes and the rest of the components had the right amount of moisture so the salad wasn't soggy. We chased the salad with their raw oysters with were, again, some of the best I've ever had. They were so fresh and the salt water from which they were taken seasoned them perfectly. Following the oysters we were served complimentary Pommes Paillasson and the Straws - perfectly done. Our meat dish was the Braised Lamb Neck, which the bartender warned us would be rich. And it was! It's served in the size and shape of a 4Oz steak and looks fairly harmless, but is very rich with great flavor. I'd recommend sharing the lamb neck plate because it can be a little too rich for one person. All in all, the food was delicious and well-presented.   The decor was great too. The walk through the SLS was a little weird and the place was empty, but once we were in the restaurant, I enjoyed the setting and walking past the grill and meat case on our way to our table - great mix of form and function for a steakhouse.

zI1Iqmh5MPE4UVV1XQomnA.text: We came here to splurge on a nice steak dinner and ordered a rib eye, the quality suppose to be close to Waggyu beef.  However, the grass-fed, extremely lean meat made it tough to chew.  Upon discovery of this situation, the manager, Pano, immediately took action and corrected the meat, he replaced it with much tender cut of the beef.  At the end, he asked our server, Stephanie, which had the best customer service quality, to not charge for the steak.  They completely turn our dining experience around into the most positive experience.  We will definitely recommend this place to our friends.  Great job, Pano and Stephanie. We will be back.

GCOgYneYD56K7dGDVz9MGQ.text: Got a comp to this gourmet restaurant and I am glad that I went.  Incredible selection of meat dishes with spectacular side dishes, e.g., mash potatoes, spinach, cauliflower, etc.  Service, ambiance and tasting menu are all top notch.  This place is not cheap but if you want to eat real meat whether it be blood sausage, lamb chops, steak or pork save your calories for here.

v6_sRKyqeGa_xjnqKNk3dA.text: Incredible service and meal.  Got two free dishes: old-fashioned/modern olives (bomb and I'm not an olive fan, 4/5) and the bagel lox cone (raw dill was too overpowering 2/5)  Here is what was paid for:  -beef & parmesan grissini carpaccio 4/5 interesting how it's presented -classic beef tartare 5/5 my favorite of the night -fois gras cotton candy 3/5 great concept -suckling pig sandwich 5/5 tasty, great deal -catalan spinach 4/5 pretty good -delmonico potatoes 3/5 standard starch -veal chop 5/5 excellent, so tender for being such a big cut  Definitely ate too much but I wouldn't know which dish I wouldn't order to try.  ***2nd visit on 5/9/16***  Didn't want to repeat anything we got the last time. We didn't get any free appetizers this time. It was still a great meal with great service.  -caviar flight 5/5 just wow -red oxtail steamed bun 4/5 more Asian flavor than expected -bison buffalo style carpaccio 4/5 interesting complex flavor -wagyu beef cheeks 5/5 my 2nd favorite of the night, tender asf -braised lamb neck 4/5 great flavor, a bit salty -robuchon potatoes 4/5 ... so rich, a lot of butter but tasty -the vanilla experiment dessert 3/5... the vanilla sniffing was a letdown for the price.  Still in my top 3 for restaurants on the strip.

YJecL8J3Ou9F-__rs1Ux0A.text: Another great meal at Bazaar Meats thanks to the best Maitre D in Las Vegas, Pano and staff. Thank you for making my clients dining experience exceptional. I will be back soon.

W6PsFb7ccaRzGGv3fUZ0Ew.text: Been back a few more time, tastes and flavors that are culinary genius every single time. I freaken adore this culinary madness. The best of the best in the strangest way possible.

2sxOvFIpdMLgfuguk-dgwA.text: Don't get me wrong, the place has a great ambiance and right feel. But I have come to understand, sadly that Jose Andres means expensive, over priced food... The selection is confusing, and messy... I don't recommend this to anyone who is looking for a great steak place... Walking in to SLS with empty, totally empty surrounding was itself depressing.. A total buzzkill..  I guess they have to overcharge to make you feel special that you ate at this place...  So for those who love the ambiance, go to another place and look at this place's website photos while you are enjoying your food...

_vy5jIZ47e7KSKTYIy085Q.text: What a great place, went here with a group of friends and the meal was fabulous,  service was great. Most of us had Washyugu Ribeye steaks which were absolutely delicious. Steakhouses in Vegas are on every corner and mostly overpriced and average. This is worth the money and sets itself aside from the crowd

cxiFuIAkeEZOXRV32P9rug.text: This has to be on my top pick of favorite places to dine! We ordered the 3lb steak aged 19 years, a variety of oysters, chateubriand , mashed potatoes, sausage, mushrooms, shishito peppers and everythibg was absolutely delectable! I wish the one in bh had the same concept! I am such a fan you must eat here in vegas or you are truly missing out!

QfciyEVwAPcKCYLuzsGpCw.text: Our dinner was amazing. We ordered the chicken croquettes which were the best thing we ate (not that anything else was less than awesome). We then ordered the shrimp and crab cocktail which was like a delicious seafood salsa and the sloppy joes which were amazing. We had the skirt steak - and the only reason I give it a 4 vs a 5 is that we ordered the steak medium and it was more well done. With the steak we ordered the delmonico potatoes - good, but not great.  We had the salted caramel ice cream and caramel chocolate pastry for dessert and they were great!

U1d2fzwvRT28Pych75Tsfg.text: One of the best dinners I've ever had in my life. I frequent my favorite restaurant Mastro's very often and while I love it Bazaar has a total different kind of menu. You can't go wrong ordering anything from this place. The Vittore Carpaccio was amazing! Amazing service + ambiance as always (other locations).

vWQwBPVcQdJ06fSBflQRYA.text: Ill keep it short and simple.  Second time I've dined here and its spectacular.  The Kobe A-5 filet special was melt in your mouth good and Kobe rib eye was rich and buttery.  Appetizers were out of this world including and sides were extraordinary.  Manager Yassine sets this restaurant apart from other top places in vegas by his courteous and sincere table side conversation.  Remembered our names and much more from 6 months ago and even sent over several sides and desserts complimentary.  If you love meat and great service, don't miss out on this restaurant. It really is unique and a must try.

n0MjxOSw8iR8BykOyL4xRQ.text: Was very excited to try this Jose Andres restaurant in Las Vegas. Other comments about the menus are accurate, they are ridiculously large and unwieldy. (So are the chicharrones).But what they feature is fascinating.  The "traditional" carpaccio is as good as there is. The chef's selection of charcuterie is worth trying, a remarkable variety. The steaks, especially the ribeyes, are terrific. However, keep in mind that everything is served tapas or family style...including the steaks. It is not a traditional steakhouse. You do not need to order a steak for each person. If you do, they come out separately. I'd recommend having fun with the smaller plates and then getting a steak to share.  The wine list, especially the Spanish and French selections, is impressive but pricey.  Will definitely return, but will order differently.

gZNh45LLlmDuZQMHST7Xug.text: Extremely happy The Bazaar has come to Las Vegas. I've missed the cotton candy fois gras dearly, and probably had a year's worth in one meal to make up for it. A few things are different, and there's an overwhelming amount of meat choices, which is wonderful. Not a big fan of the nori meat tacos, I think the anago cucumber ones in LA are better. Also, the Philly cheesesteaks are missing too, which was a bummer. But, the wagyu beef was on point, the wine list is solid, the patisserie tasty, and everything else was great. Glad the Magic Mojito made the cut too!

R2nr4OFf6t6aQ4Tv2qFtoA.text: Tony was the best waiter everrr!! Coming from LA, I'm used to Bazaar being a truly spectacular experience but this was above and beyond. The food was everything. The decor is strange and perfect.  And the cocktails...oh the cocktails! Perfect dining experience all around.

SvwvA3a0VQei4ijxuU-8fQ.text: We had an amazing experience. We sat at the bar and had tartar, carpaccio, and the olives. Everything was delicious. The cocktails were also great. Our staff was attentive and nice but a little awkward. Also there was a cocktail waitress directly next to us obviously ear hustling everything we said while wrapping silverware which was also awkward. The decor was IKEA. That was the only downfalls. The management staff was amazing as were the food servers. I want to go back and have s meal in the dining room.  Thank you Yaasine for a nice experience and for always being the most gracious host.

-eHwfjPrURKb2chdvSa3ug.text: Great place to go if you have an unlimited budget.  Truly the best selection of meat on the planet.  Foie Gras cotton candy is a must try.  Absolutely beautiful restaurant.  First class all the way.

7JKkCZtMilLSYktwQXjong.text: Jose Andres never ceases to impress.  I have been to Bazaar and the Saam room in LA and was never disappointed.  I can now say that Bazaar meat is a perfect addition to the Las Vegas restaurant scene and I give it two thumbs up.  Although the SLS is a bit down the strip, make the trip to eat here.  Again with Jose Andres the cuisine is spanish tapas with molecular gastronomy however this is a meat themed restaurant.  Many high end meets that include kobe beef at 40 dollars an ounce with a minimum of 6 ounces can pack a punch in your wallet but the meat quality is A+.  I opted for a tasting menu course which there are 4 of and the amount of food for the price was impeccable.  We added the classic beef tartare which was prepared at table side and it was one of the best tartars I've ever had.  The chateaubriand was cooked to perfection and we were all stuffed.  The waitstaff and service were perfect not too overbearing, but my water glass was never empty.  I plan on coming here many times in the future.  Awesome addition! Jose does it again!

-RXb4_kIdCalmDlQZo2nAg.text: OUTSTANDING!  I had the pleasure of celebrating my 40th birthday here this past weekend. It was by far one of the most outstanding meals I've had in my life (i've lived all over the world and currently live in a world-class resort, we eat well). The menu selection is phenomenal so therefore we opted to go with one of their well constructed tasting menus (15 courses, it was not cheap but worth every penny). You cannot go wrong with any of their meats, the cotton candy foie gras is absolutely amazing along with the potatoes and the suckling pig. The bartender makes an amazing Knob Creek Old Fashion. Service was top-notch, it seemed as if it was a never-ending team ensuring we did not  have to ask for anything. Massive thanks to the entire staff for making this in an experience we will never forget!

tKtEFxDZB0gJG3UgOviwKw.text: Cool place but can't eat dinner at the bar!!!!! Stick with STK at Cosmo. Great bartenders!

93keUHfY92sTPqdTS4l2tA.text: I heard good things about this place and I stayed in SLS for this restaurant.  VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!  Poor service overall and not ready for family with baby...  400 dollar dinner in vain.  Never coming back.

kMmj68s-wV4qdEFqlkUubQ.text: Incredible place.  Had the suckling pig which is a must.  The Wagyu steak was off the charts good ! From top down, this is a must eat place.  Jose Andres has done it again !

m2d7_EZALfXhTqS7HPwv0g.text: Definitely stop in for a drink and appetizer. It is an interesting restaurant concept and looks cool. Bottom line its about the quality of food and service. I ordered the preset menu which featured lots of bite sized appetizers. It was ok but I really wanted to try the suckling pig. It sucked! I read lots of reviews some liked it many didn't. I was served a.small portion from shoulder area filled with layers of fat. Im Cuban and we roasts pigs all the time. In Miami or California there is no way you pay $140 for a 2 lb portion of pig. Yolo and I figured this has to be different. Not. Roasted pig is roasted pig is roasted pig. It's not a fine peace of beef. We each paid $275 for the pre-set menu. Service was poorly timed ,waiters friendly but lacking training. After spending $550 between on this experience I felt it was not worth it. Have your steaks at a real steak house. Some things are ok , the place is half empty for a reason. Overpriced. Fair food and friendly but Denny's quality service. Good luck.

ILylnAVCdkomS4frHmrZ4g.text: Tried bazaar meat for the first time a few days ago for my boyfriends birthday. We had been wanting to try this place for awhile and were very excited. If I was just rating the food I would give it 4 stars. We had the tartare sliders, salmon tartare, pork skin, rack of lamb (our fav), chicken, robuchon potatoes, cauliflower, and the suckling pig. Although pricey the ingredients were very good quality and prepared perfectly. I had to give this experience 3 stars because the ambience and dining experience wasn't there for the price tag. Our table in particular was in a very awkward spot and small for 5 people at a family style restaurant. Our waitress seemed very flustered and we felt forgotten about. The menu was a little confusing. It's tapas but she had us order everything at once and then the timing on how our items came out was off. The sommelier never visited our table and our waitress barely checked in on us. Also I expect a restaurant of this caliber to do something a little extra when you make a reservation and say it's for a celebration, most fine dining I've eaten at always does this and our waitress never even mentioned or asked anything. Anyway bottom line food was excellent but for the price I expected a better and more enjoyable dining experience. We are local but I won't be going back

psW71RyQDLL-1d-udvWmxQ.text: Bazaar meats was the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant,  and would never recommend to anyone.  My $180 steak took an hour to be served to me, and when it did the meat was so far rare that the center texture of the flesh was completely raw. What were they doing for an hour?? Twiddling there thumbs I presume. I sent it back and 10 minutes later it was medium. Potatoes were mushy and unseasoned, I had to practically chase the waiter for another beverage. I woulda had a better prepared meal at a McDonald's than bazaar meat. Never again, $300 bill between me and my guest for bad service and garbage served on a plate

YCka1olgLPXNT_K4ua5blA.text: The steak tartare was probably one of the best I've ever had. The meal itself was excellent but the service was phenomenal. Natalie was an amazing waitress!

W_ANA84rwfDik9C9iszOJA.text: This place is fabulous! My hubby and I have been here twice for special occasions and the service has always been impeccable. It is certainly pricey but every steak, app and side dish we have tried has been worth the cost for a special treat. The last time we went a server made an error and brought us the Gazpacho shots meant for another table and when we told then we did not order them, they let us keep them free of charge as well as bringing us an additional app to have free of charge. Wonderful food, great selection, pricey alcohol (but what isn't on the strip), and a great experience overall.

06CuZ2TW_AaOB9Zcard8xw.text: The beautiful and creative aspects of this uniques restaurant are overshadowed by how tremendously expensive it is.  By any measures Bazaar Meat takes everything to another level.  This is not a steak house.  The food was OK. However, I felt like there was no congruity between what we were served and the prices.  Perhaps I should have done more research ahead of my meal.  If I had I would have gone somewhere else.

cJpTGiQloilaG_V2qYwH3Q.text: meaty heaven.  went with a large group and got the mid level tasting menu.  part molecular gastronomy, part old school done right, all delicious.  go with a tasting menu, sit back, and enjoy.  don't worry about portions.  we had waaaaay more food than we could finish.

-WoztMeNtqOpfegath5S0g.text: On a recent visit to Las Vegas--solo, mind you--I found myself with the option to try any restaurant my heart desires, but something was tugging me back to Bazaar Meat.  You see, a year or so ago, my wife and I spent weeks deciding on which place to dine for the celebratory meal for our marriage, and after highly scrutinizing the lists, we settled on Bazaar Meat.  We arrived full of excitement and anticipation for what we'd expected to be one of the finer dining experiences of our lives... what we had was a 3-hour experience where our server treated us like royalty, but our food was incredibly underwhelming and bland.  At close to $400, we expected more.  So fast forward to my free night after a successful work day, and I found myself on the phone, asking about stopping in.  I'd just walked the length of the strip and back and settled into a spot at the bar, where the full menu awaits.  As the server approached, I explained why I was back--a chance for redemption.  She asked me to hold my thought, and stepped away for a few minutes before returning.  To put it lightly, the red carpet was rolled out for me.  No, my meal wasn't free, but many courses were provided and I couldn't draw a comparison between the two visits.  This time, the steak was cooked to perfection, which was an ideal entree after the smoked oysters and several other bites beforehand.  The sprouts were heavenly, and the potatoes (which I said I wouldn't want) were a very welcome freebie, as they were hands down the best I've had outside of Peru.    The best compliment I can pay in addition to the appreciation and pleasure received on this visit, is that I will indeed make it a point to return with my wife so she can experience what we both missed out on a year ago.  Well done, Bazaar Meat, redemption granted!

CCCdS63RlCYCXlWwzixmRA.text: We have to eat here every time we go to Vegas.  The Suckling Duck is so good same as their Steaks.  The Cotton candy foie gras is a must, Foie gras smores, Foie gras waffle to die for. Kobe beef tartar, Robuchon mash potatoes are very good.  Don't  care for the chicharron.  I can eat there everyday if I can afford.   The service is great.  We love all his restaurants like.

GZNSXKZUs8GmcpR9SNA88A.text: Bazaar Meat by Chef Jose Andres Amazing!  One of the best dinners I've had exelent service,  table side amenities the food is unforgettable & different dining experiences available.   You can do ala carte menu, participate of there 3 different taisting menu, simply seat by the charcuterie bar or reserve a private taisting you won't go wrong with any of the alternatives.  Great wine list & some craft beer can complement you dinner. There high quality of products definitely sets them up for success.   There kitchen equipment is spectacular,  the wood burning grill greets you on your way in and sets high expectations. When your steak gets to your table it's worth every penny melts in your mouth!  Great for a romantic dinner or just enjoying food at it's finest.  If you are at the SLS Hotel Las Vegas you must stop at Bazaar Meat what an experience!

1qQbA65mzR8ccMc4uyZ5dg.text: We were really excited to try Jose's new restaurant because we are big fans of all his other ones, and this one was certainly on par with the rest. I started with the cotton candy cocktail, which was good but probably not worth the $. It was a really pretty and whimsical presentation though.  We tried a variety of dishes, and our waiter was so kind in sending some samples from the kitchen: the cotton candy foie gras (same as what Bazzar in LA had before banning foie gras), the bagel and lox cone (not worth the $, save it for the main course!), the smoked and ice oysters (an unique take worth trying), and the Foieffle (A MUST).  For the main course we had the Mishima Reserve (their steaks go by weight, I think ours was around 2 lbs. with plenty to take home), the mushrooms (an unique take different from your average roasted), and the Delmonico (very Joel Robuchon like). It was fantastic, and overall up there with my personal favorite, Craftsteak. I really do recommend coming with a large party so you can try lots of different things.  We really wanted to try the suckling pig and our waiter recommended the sandwich version. I didn't find it particularly special, but maybe the real entree is more noteworthy.   All in all, a great choice to dine, but of course one must make the trip all the way down to SLS!

opMuTpKxbyP6O5aVL7thFQ.text: This was such an amazing experience. The quality of the food is superb. The drinks are incredible. I had one of the tasting menus and enjoyed everything! I was able to swap out an item that I was unable to eat and so I really commend the staff for  being accommodating. Our server was very knowledgeable about everything. Definitely recommend trying this place. 5 stars!

IPjTCedvOlpvcrlCGHy4TA.text: the service was great!! the decor was super cool and eccentric! They had the fire roaring and all the meat displayed out! The prices were too outrageous for the mediocre food!   we had the lindsay ranch ribeye, the kobe steak, the peanut fed ham, the classic tartar, patatas bravas and the mushrooms!   soo.. lets break down what we ate...  lindsay ranch ribeye: we thought hey! in vegas right? lets get the best one! the flavor of the beef was good but the chew... my jaw still hurts form the constant chewing that went down...  kobe: do i need to say anything... delish! soft and melts in your mouth! then on top of that we got a certificate with a nose print of the black kobe cow... poor cow! but still yummy in my tummy!  peanut fed ham: you could taste the peanut... we really wanted the bellota but we took the cheap route but it was a good substitute!!  the classic tartar:  yummmmm!! that tartar was goood! table side presentation! big portion!   patatas bravas: crispy but soft on the inside! 6 pieces of potato...   mushrooms: were roasted with olive oil, garlic and parsley.... they  worked well with the rich beef taste!!

NUU20lqCifbw7vFx2lnalA.text: Fantastic food!  I had the classic tasting menu and all the dishes were great. I especially loved the chicken croquets and the cured jamon.

8CeOppj_LiHx87EpacAwSw.text: I hosted a group of 35 people and we had the $185 tasting menu and it was a fabulous experience. Service was excellent and a very complex multi-course meal went off without any issues.  The food was fabulous! Everyone agreed it was the best steak that they had ever had. It was very flavorful and grilled to perfection.  The tasting menu was full of surprises and it kept the group fully engaged with new taste experiences.  It was an awesome experience, five stars does not do it justice!

bO-3ErH5GjZ17u3Zatr4uQ.text: We would not know if the food is any good... because WE WERE NEVER LET IN!  We had a 10p reservation for right after our show... which was The Eddie Griffin Experience... which was right next door... like less than 100 feet away.  We got there at 10:09p and we were told that they have a 10 mn grace period and that their kitchen closed at 10p and could not serve us. (Note: We has a 10p reservation) The hostess was, in a word, inexperienced!  She basically refused to serve us, and was so matter of fact about their "rule" of 10 mns late = loss of reservation.  She could care less that we were paying customers, who just spent money on a show down the hall that had just ended and precluded us. from being there any earlier.  If you wonder why the SLS is dead these days... it's because they simply do not have the service of the other hotels.  After being refused service for being 9 mns late, we left and had a delicious dinner at STK in the Cosmopolitan (which was hopping with people at 10:45p on a Monday night) This was after eating a perfect dinner at the new Scotch 80 Prime inside of The Palms the night before.  We spent over $500 on that bill... so, who is the loser?  You, Bazaar Meat.  I'll be sure to tell all of my friends.

et_GIDIz5ksbNRJEjE4iHg.text: Before I even get into how perfectly decadent the food is... I have to say the service was so superior and welcoming. Every single person on this perfectly put together and in sink team, each equally important in their role. Everyone was so  knowledgeable and offered exquisite service.  With that said !! I ordered the classic tasting menu. And every single dish on there was so flavorful and perfectly paired to make your mouth water!!! I can't say enough good things about this Restaurant.   I think the classic tartare was the best beef tartare I have ever had! So tasty. Then such a small yet still as important tapas, the olive and wrapped bagel lox, was so amazing. Even then endives Cesar salad was so flavorful, leaving you wanting more. Seriously everything I tasted there was amazing the chef even made me their Tomato steak-tartare and that was so fresh, juicy and flavorful. I don't think there is any wrong choices here. Right down to the amazing and creative desert and we can't forget the drinks. I had their smoked old fashion. I can with out a doubt say that is the best smoked old fashion I have tasted!   Thank you so much to the manager Pano and Elias the meat captain who helped me with my choices and gave me the more then first class service. I'll be returning for sure and I highly recommend you all do as well. It's really worth every dollar spent here.  I can't believe I haven even here before but i promise it won't be the last!

F-uY28yxTryArxnv6ZsEeg.text: Amazing meal. Everything was perfect. Bone in ribeye. Brussel sprouts. Oysters. Lobster and shrimp. Chicken croquettes. Asparagus. Fois gras cotton candy. Steak tartar.   For 6 folks...we ordered a fois gras. Cotton candy for each. 2 orders of steak tartar. 6 oysters. One order of lobster and shrimp. BIibULB32pUM_j13cfDfww.text: This is by far the best restaurant in Las Vegas. If you are looking for an amazing Culinary experience this is the place to dine.  The service was exceptional and the food was worth every dollar spent plus more!  John, Pano and the rest of the staff were super attentive to every detail and the customer experience obviously was number 1.

UZ5P57msrIR3RTjZDOiAYw.text: I have tried the Miami and the Beverly Hills locations, but, hands down the Vegas location takes it to the next level. The nitrogen citrus cocktail and the Mojito are AMAZING.  Let the tasting menu take you for a ride, it's the best $170 flight you can invest on your belly.

yJTcNScNiqWYmu1P9aLgfg.text: I came here for dinner on a Saturday night with a group of 4 others.  While it doesn't quite earn 5 stars from me (which I don't often give), Bazaar Meat comes damn close!  Bazaar Meat isn't cheap, that's for certain, and the dining experience does take a while, but nearly everything I tried here was excellent!  I truly don't recall a low point of this meal, from the service to the quality of the food to the decor. Even the displays of raw meat and vintage slicers and food prep equipment at the center of this restaurant where some of the cooking and food prep. is done were a really cool touch to the look of the place!  When we were given menus, I was a bit confused at first, as some of their meats were listed as 2.5 pounds.  One of the steaks listed in the "not so big" section of the menu was 22 oz!  What??  Then along came our server to explain that the concept here is to order a few dishes that are large enough to be shared.  He also explained that some of their cuts of meat are made to be cooked, smoked or go through other types of preparation that takes several hours.  Here they basically do the hours of work ahead of time so that most of their meats simply need to go through the last 40 or so minutes of cooking and preparation once you order them.  This made one of the guys at our table a bit nervous as we were seated at 7 and he needed to depart for the airport no later than 8:30 to catch a red eye.  Our server promised this wouldn't be a problem, and certainly enough, he was right.  For starters we had the croquetas de jamon and gazpacho shots. For the main courses, we had the pork loin with roasted apples, the lamb and the tenderloin steak. We also ordered the asparagus and spinach with apple, pine nuts, shallots and raisins.  As mentioned, I can't remember a downside to the meal, everything was excellent and all the meat dishes were cooked perfectly. I also liked that a side was included and served with nearly every one of the meat dishes which complimented it perfectly...The pork came with roasted apples, the steak came with a sauce and the lamb also was delivered with a condiment to compliment the flavor of the meat.  We left here full but not stuffed which was great, and to boot, they got the one member of our party out the door in time to catch his flight, just as the server promised!

AZoFEQQId4XjFWQqUMZ2Og.text: This place exceeded all expectations. Wasn't really sure what to expect as its in SLS which was empty. The restaurant was going full on though and was amazing.   Food wise, the cotton candy fois gras was in the top 3 things I have ever eaten. From there we had several different kinds of oysters, caviar, and table side tartar. All of were very good. From there we had the reserve ribeye which was also very good. We ordered a few different desserts, all of which were great small bites. And then we had more for fois, seriously it was that good.   All of this made an above average meal, but what really pushed it over the top was our waitress Chelsea. She was one of the most knowledgable and personable servers anywhere. Not only did she know everything about the menu, she took the time to craft our dinner experience specifically to our tastes. She was amazing.
